00022 /**
00023  * @file   SelfCreate.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Tue Nov  8 08:56:26 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Small interface for functions that know how to make an instance of
00028  * themselves given a map of key, value parameters. Idea is that you can call
00029  * this class's static methods generically and dynamic_cast appropriately.
00030  */
00031

00033 #include "chipstream/SelfCreate.h"

00043 using namespace std;
00044 /** 
00045  * Chop up a string into a vector of words separated by '.' while trying to
00046  * respect floating point digits.
00047  * 
00048  * @param s - string of interest.
00049  * @param words - vector to put words into, will be cleared then filled.
00050  */
00051 void SelfCreate::chopStringWithFloats(const std::string &s, std::vector<std::string> &words) {
00052   int len = 0, start = 0, next = 0, peek = 0, eqPos = 0;
00053   char delim = '.', pairDelim = '=';
00054   words.clear();
00055   len = s.length();
00056   bool bQuoted = false;
00057   while(start < len) {
00058     bool doFloat = true;
00059     int pos = 0;
00060     /* Look for the next '.' character and peek at the
00061        one after that to see if we are doing a float. */
00062         bQuoted = false;
00063     next = (int)s.find(delim, start);
00064     peek = (int)s.size();
00065     if(next == -1) { 
00066       next = (int)s.size(); 
00067     }
00068     else {
00069                 peek = (int)s.find('\'', start+1);
00070                 if (peek != -1) 
00071                 {
00072                         bQuoted = true;
00073                         next = (int)s.find('\'', peek+1);
00074                         if (next == -1) {next = (int)s.size();}
00075                 }
00076                 else {peek = (int)s.find(delim, next+1);}
00077       if(peek == -1)
00078           {
00079         peek = (int)s.size();
00080           }
00081     }
00082         if (bQuoted)
00083         {
00084                 std::string str = s.substr(start, next - start);
00085                 int iPosition = str.find('\'');
00086                 str = str.substr(0, iPosition) + str.substr(iPosition+1);
00087                 words.push_back(str);
00088                 next++;
00089         }
00090         else
00091         {               
00092      
00093     /* The doFloat checks are to handle cases like 
00094        .myparam=2.0. */
00095     /* Check to see if we are all digits past the '=' separator... */
00096     eqPos = (int)s.find(pairDelim, start);
00097     if(eqPos == -1 || eqPos >= peek)
00098       doFloat = false;
00099     for(pos = eqPos+1; pos < next && doFloat; pos++) {
00100       if( !( isdigit(s[pos]) || s[pos] == '-' || s[pos] == '+' ) ) {
00101         doFloat = false;
00102         break;
00103       }
00104     }
00105     /* check to see that second half of float is also digits. */
00106     for(pos = next+1; pos < peek && doFloat; pos++) {
00107       if( !isdigit(s[pos]) ) {
00108         doFloat = false;
00109         break;
00110       }
00111     }
00112     if(doFloat)
00113       next = peek;
00114     words.push_back(s.substr(start, next - start));
00115     }
00116     start = next+1;
00117   }
00118 }

00120 /** 
00121  * @brief Take a string of from "name.param1=value1.param2=value2" and populate the
00122  * name and paramMap objects with it.
00123  * @param spec String description of name and parameters.
00124  * @param name Will contain name after call.
00125  * @param paramMap Parameter key/value pairs will be filled in.
00126  */
00127 void SelfCreate::fillInNameParam(const std::string &spec, std::string &name, 
00128                                  std::map<std::string, std::string> &paramMap) {
00129   vector<string> words;
00130   string param;
00131   paramMap.clear();
00132   string::size_type position = spec.find(".");
00133   if(position == string::npos) {
00134     name = spec;
00135   }
00136   else {
00137     unsigned int i = 0;
00138     vector<string> params;
00139     name = spec.substr(0, position);
00140     chopStringWithFloats(spec.substr(position+1), params);
00141     for(i = 0; i < params.size(); i++) {
00142                 
00143       string::size_type ePos = params[i].find("=");
00144       if(ePos == string::npos) {
00145                 Verbose::out(1, "*");
00146         for(int j = 0; j < params.size(); j++) {
00147           Verbose::out(1, "Parsed parameter " + ToStr(j) + " is " + params[j]);
00148         }               
00149                 Verbose::out(1, "*");
00150                 Verbose::out(1, "Try surrounding the value with single quotes.");
00151                 Verbose::out(1, "*");
00152         Err::errAbort("Must specify a key=value pair in parameter: " + spec);
00153       }
00154       paramMap[params[i].substr(0,ePos)] = params[i].substr(ePos+1);
00155     }
00156   }
00157 }
00158 
00159 /** 
00160  * @brief Check the proposed parameters in query against the allowed
00161  * in gold. Specifically checks to make sure all of the keys in
00162  * allowed are keys in gold.
00163  * 
00164  * @param query Proposed key/value pairs for parameters.
00165  * @param gold Allowed key/description pairs for parameters.
00166  * @param badParam Vector filled with keys for param found to be bad.
00167  * 
00168  * @return true if all keys in query are keys in gold, false otherwise
00169  */
00170 bool SelfCreate::validParam(const std::map<std::string,std::string> &query,
00171                             SelfDoc &doc,
00172                             std::vector<std::string> &badParam) {
00173   std::map<std::string,std::string>::const_iterator iter;
00174   bool allOk = true;
00175   badParam.clear();
00176   for(iter = query.begin(); iter != query.end(); iter++) {
00177     if(!doc.validParam(iter->first)) {
00178       badParam.push_back(iter->first);
00179       allOk = false;
00180     }
00181   }
00182   return allOk;
00183 }
00184 
00185 bool SelfCreate::canMake(const std::string &spec, std::vector<SelfDoc> &docs) {
00186   string name;
00187   map<string, string> param;
00188   unsigned int i = 0;
00189   SelfCreate::fillInNameParam(spec, name, param);
00190   for (i = 0; i < docs.size(); i++) {
00191     if (docs[i].getDocName() == name) { 
00192       return true;
00193     }
00194   }
00195   return false;
00196 }
00197 
00198 /** 
00199  * @brief Create an object requested by the specification string by matching
00200  * it against the self documenting classes and then calling the matching self
00201  * creator function. Resulting object must be delete'd when done.
00202  * 
00203  * @param spec - String specification of object requested.
00204  * @param docs - Vector of selfdoc objects to look in for name of object to be made.
00205  * @param creators - Vector of creation functions to use for creating object.
00206  * @param typeDescription - What type of object are we attempting to make?
00207  * @param error - If true call errAbort when don't recognize value, otherwise return NULL.
00208  * @return Pointer to new SelfCreate object, delete when finished.
00209  */
00210 SelfCreate *SelfCreate::selfCreateFromString(const std::string &spec, std::vector<SelfDoc> &docs,
00211                                              std::vector<SelfCreate::selfCreator> &creators, 
00212                                              const std::string &typeDescription, bool error) {
00213   string name;
00214   map<string, string> param;
00215   vector<string> badParam;
00216   unsigned int i = 0;
00217   SelfCreate *create = NULL;
00218   SelfCreate::fillInNameParam(spec, name, param);
00219   /* Loop through known types. */
00220   for(i = 0; i < docs.size(); i++) {
00221     if(docs[i].getDocName() == name) {
00222       /* Check the parameters. */
00223       if(SelfCreate::validParam(param, docs[i], badParam)) {
00224         create = (*creators[i])(param);
00225       }
00226       else { /* Bad param, tell user. */
00227         string bad;
00228         unsigned int badIx = 0;
00229         for(badIx = 0; badIx < badParam.size(); badIx++) {
00230           bad += badParam[badIx];
00231           bad += ",";
00232         }
00233         Err::errAbort("Invalid parameters for " + name + ": " + bad);
00234       }
00235       return create;
00236     }
00237   }
00238   if(error)
00239     Err::errAbort("Don't know how to make object for name: " + name + " of type: " + typeDescription);
00240   return NULL;
00241 }
